# Contributing Guide [![Contributor Convenant v2.0 Code of Conduct][badge-conduct]][link-conduct] [![Apache 2.0 license][badge-license]][link-license]

Want to contribute to this project? Wow, you're the best! 😍 Every little bit
helps, and since this project follows the
[all-contributors](link-allcontributors) specification [credit will always be
given][link-contributors]. ✨

>  **Note:** This project is released with a respect-oriented [Contributor Code
of Conduct][link-conduct], based on the [Contributor Covenant][link-covenant].
By participating in this project you agree to abide by its fair terms.

You can contribute in many ways:

## Types of Contributions [![All Contributors][badge-contributors]][link-allcontributors] [![Issues queue][badge-issues]][link-issues]

### Report Bugs

If you are reporting a bug, please [open an issue][link-issues] and include:

* A description of the bug.
* Detailed steps to reproduce the bug, unless the issue is obvious.
* Any details about your local setup that might be helpful in troubleshooting.

### Submit Feedback or Propose New Features

If you have an idea to share, please [open an issue][link-issues]:

* Explain in detail how it would work.
* Keep the scope as narrow as possible, to make it easier to implement.
* Remember that this is a volunteer-driven project, and that contributions
  are welcome! 😃

### Fix Bugs or Implement Features

Look through the [issues queue][link-issues] for bugs and features. Anything
tagged with `bug`, `enhancement` and `help wanted` is open to whoever wants to
implement it. You rock! 😎

### Share With the World [![Tweet][badge-twitter]][link-twitter]

Projects that are unpopular end up all sad and alone. 😿 Help this one thrive by
talking to the world about its glorious existence in blog posts, forums threads,
social media, article, anywhere you may see fit! We love you! 😍

## Get Started! [![Fork me on GitHub][badge-repo]][link-repo] [![Conventional Commits v1.0.0][badge-conventional-commits]][link-conventional-commits]

Ready to contribute? Here's how to set up this project for local development.

1. [Fork this repo][link-repo] on GitHub.
2. Clone your fork locally:

    ```shell
    git clone git@github.com:your_name_here/project.git
    ```

3. Create a branch for local development:

    ```shell
    git checkout -b name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature
    ```

   Now you can make your changes locally.

4. Commit your changes, ideally using
[Conventional Commits][link-conventional-commits] comment style, and push your
branch to GitHub:

    ```shell
    git add .
    git commit -m "type(scope): active voice summary of changes"
    git push origin name-of-your-bugfix-or-feature
    ```

5. [Submit a pull request][link-pulls] through GitHub.

### Proposing Pull Requests [![Pull requests][badge-pulls]][link-pulls]

[Pull requests][link-pulls] are very welcome! 🍰 Note that if you are going to
propose drastic changes, be sure to [open an issue][link-issues] for discussion
first, to make sure that your PR will be accepted before you spend effort
coding it.

>  **Working on your first Pull Request?** You can learn how from the free
online course [How to Contribute to an Open Source Project][link-course].

😃 Yay! 🎈
